class:
This is the FILEMQ/2.0 client protocol handler
Names of states, events, and actions are case insensitive. By convention however we use uppercase for protocol events.
Start up the client, connect to the server, and initiate a conversation with the server. This is a short lived state and will either error on connection, e.g. bad endpoint, or it will move on to connecting.
The dealer socket was not successfully connected to the server. This could be due to a bad endpoint.
The server is now connected and the user can be notified with a success message via the command pipe.
If the timeout occurs during connection, terminate via the bombcmd event.
This event corresponds with the API method set inbox. This event will leave the client in the connected state waiting for a valid event.
This event corresponds with the API method subscribe. When the actions of this event finish the client will move to the subscribing state.
This event corresponds with the API destructor. This will tell the server we're leaving and then terminate.
Success or failure is required for the destructor api.
In this state, error can be triggered from the subscribe event to signal bad parameter from the "subscribe" API method. This is not fatal, so stay in this state.
Handle timeout in messaging from server by sending a ping. Will try multiple times before giving up.
Wait for the server to respond to the subscription reuqest.
Subscription was successful, tell our user and move to the subscribed state. A send credit will be triggered from this action.
In this state, we have our inbox and at least one subscription.
Send the credit.
Receive a portion of a file and make sure that the client has credit with the server.
Finished receiving current changes. Make sure client has credit.
This event corresponds with the API destructor. This will tell the server we're leaving and then terminate.
Success or failure is required for the destructor api.
Handle timeout in messaging from server by sending a ping. Will try multiple times before giving up.
Just keeping the connection alive.
This event is used when a connection timeout occurs on a synchronous API call.
This event is used when a communication timeout occurs and the client is not in the middle of handling an API call.
Connect to server endpoint, with specified timeout in msecs (zero means wait forever). Connect succeeds if connection is successful.
Disconnect from server.
Subscribe to a directory on the server, directory specified by path.
Tell the api where to store files. This should be done before subscribing to anything.
